title: Workshop on Designing Computer-Based Scientific Inquiry Educational Tools

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy, secondary-level science foundational knowledge (including experimental design and data analysis methods), and understanding of the scientific inquiry process
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices (BYOD) to design and apply computer-based educational tools integrated into science curricula, producing inquiry-centered deliverables applicable to real classrooms (experiment observation logs, data analysis templates) through project-based assessment.

learning_goals: Designing a digital content production process for science curricula and implementing variable-controlled experiment simulations using XML-based open-source tools.
Building an educational resource distribution system in a JAVA-based cross-platform environment and integrating scientific data visualization functionalities.
Developing inquiry-based instructional materials that decouple content from delivery methods for flexible application across diverse educational contexts.

Learners collaborate in teams of 3–4 to design two primary/secondary science education scenarios (including hypothesis setting, experimentation, analysis, and conclusion derivation), produce project-based assessment materials (with rubrics), and receive expert panel feedback averaging ≥4/5 on a 5-point scale.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
